summary: The bill, titled the Protecting Americans from Russian Litigation Act of 2025, aims to limit civil actions in US courts that are related to US sanctions. It prevents individuals, other than the US government, from bringing claims based on foreign judgments or arbitral awards arising from actions taken to comply with US sanctions or if those awards are based on US sanctions. The bill also includes provisions to ensure that US persons are not disadvantaged by sanctions compliance and provides exceptions for certain existing rights and remedies.
